app.title: Structured Data Extractor
app.subtitle: Extract structured data from files using a custom schema you define here. Simplified demo for quick tests.

files.title: Files
files.dropHint: Drag & drop files here or click to select

help.prompt: Task-specific instruction. Used to describe what to extract.
help.system: Global behavior/rules for the model. Applied to all requests.
help.model: Choose the provider model to run the extraction.

prompt.label: Prompt
prompt.placeholder: Extract the requested fields from the input. Keep responses concise.

system.label: System Instruction
system.placeholder: Do not fabricate data. Use null when information is missing. Follow the provided JSON schema strictly.

steps.config: Add your files on the left (PDFs or images, scanned or digital).
steps.fields: Add the fields you want on the right (for example: Invoice number, Date, Total).
steps.files: Optionally add a description for each field if you need to specify details.
steps.submit: You can also add a prompt to give global context.
steps.limits: You may add system instructions. By default, if a value isn’t found it will be left empty rather than invented.

errors.configMissing: API_URL not configured. Create web/config.js from config.example.js.
errors.sizeWarning: Large total upload size; may hit server limit
errors.sizeExceeded: Total upload size exceeds the allowed limit

defaults.systemInstruction: Do not make up data. Use null if information is missing. Respond strictly matching the provided schema.

about.title: About this demo
about.intro: This tool shows how AI can read your documents and turn them into clean, structured data. Upload a file, define the fields you need, and see the results instantly — no more copy-pasting or manual filling.

files.title: What kind of files can I process?
files.intro: In this demo you can try PDFs and images — whether scanned or digital. Common examples include:
items: Invoices and receipts → totals, dates, VAT, vendor, product lines.
CVs and résumés → names, contact details, skills.

workflow.title: How could this fit into your workflow?
workflow.intro: The same engine can be adapted in many ways, for example:
items: Watch a folder on your computer and automatically update a spreadsheet.
Read your email inbox and process attachments as they arrive.
Process a batch of files and create a new spreadsheet.
